content:
Coconut oil will add a rich, creamy flavor to your Tropical Granola.

For nuts, you can choose one or a combination of the following to add crunch and flavor:

1. **Macadamia Nuts**: These nuts are a classic tropical choice and pair perfectly with coconut and pineapple. They're also high in healthy fats and have a rich, buttery flavor.
2. **Pecans**: Pecans have a rich, nutty flavor that complements the sweetness of pineapple and mango. They're also a good source of antioxidants and healthy fats.
3. **Cashews**: Cashews have a creamy, sweet flavor that works well with the tropical flavors. They're also a good source of magnesium and copper.
4. **Hazelnuts**: Hazelnuts have a distinct, nutty flavor that pairs well with the coconut and fruit. They're also high in vitamin E and copper.
5. **Pistachios**: Pistachios have a mild, nutty flavor and a soft, chewy texture. They're a good source of protein, fiber, and healthy fats.

You can toast the nuts lightly before adding them to the granola mixture to bring out their flavors. Simply spread the nuts on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for 5-7 minutes, or until fragrant and lightly browned.

Remember to chop the nuts coarsely before adding them to the granola mixture so they're evenly distributed.

Now, go ahead and add your chosen nuts to the Tropical Granola recipe. You can't go wrong with a combination of macadamia nuts and pecans, but feel free to experiment with different nuts to find your favorite!
